kubernetes_network_form_gateway_descript: You can configure how your worker nodes route outgoing traffic (for example, to retrieve images from a repository).
kubernetes_network_form_gateway_public_d: Each node will use its own public interface
kubernetes_network_form_gateway_private_: Select if you want to use a
or customised as configured in your private network.
IP address of your gateway (leave empty to use the gateway defined by DHCP)
kubernetes_network_form_gateway_vrack_fi: Please enter a valid IP address
kubernetes_network_form_description: IP addresses from the selected private network’s VLAN will be assigned to your nodes.
kubernetes_network_form_subnet: Choose a subnet for your cluster
kubernetes_network_form_subnet_descripti: Select the subnet to use for your Managed Kubernetes Service cluster. Please ensure that it meets the network requirements for the Managed Kubernetes Service.
kubernetes_network_form_subnet_error_no_: The selected subnet does not have a specific gateway. The Load Balancer can only handle internal traffic within a private network (private to private).

If you want your Load Balancer to handle incoming internet traffic effectively, please create a new subnet or choose an existing one with a specific gateway. To learn more about public to public, or public to private architecture,
kubernetes_network_form_subnet_error_def: An error has occurred loading the subnets for this private network: {{ error }}.
kubernetes_network_form_load_balancers_s: Choose a dedicated subnet for your Load Balancers

You can define a specific subnet for your Load Balancers. This is particularly important if the subnet you have chosen for your cluster does not meet the requirements for creating OVHcloud Managed Load Balancers.
kubernetes_network_form_gateway_mode_aut: Default gateway set according to your private network DHCP configuration (recommended)
kubernetes_network_form_gateway_mode_cus: IP address of your default gateway
kubernetes_network_form_rebuild: Warning: changing the outgoing routing strategy involves redeploying the nodes in your cluster by rolling update.
kubernetes_network_form_notify_users: You need a subnet with an attached gateway to deploy the Managed Kubernetes Service across three availability zones (3-AZ). To ensure your private network works smoothly, make sure it meets these requirements.
kubernetes_network_form_no_private_netwo: Configuring your Kubernetes network requires a private network. We recommend creating a private network if you don’t already have one.
kubernetes_network_form_no_associated_ga: A managed gateway needs to be attached to your private network during the beta phase.
